THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE

BY-LAW NUMBER 2005-200

A BY-LAW TO AUTHORIZE THE DIRECTOR OF ENGINEERING AND PUBLIC
WORKS TO ISSUE PERMITS TO MOVE VEHICLES, LOADS, OBJECTS OR
STRUCTURES IN EXCESS OF WEIGHT AND SIZE LIMITS PRESCRIBED BY THE
HIGHWAY TRAFFIC ACT ON CITY ROADS AND TO ESTABLISH CONDITIONS FOR
WHICH SUCH PERMITS MAY BE ISSUED

WHEREAS the Municipal Corporation or other authority having jurisdiction over a
highway may, upon application in writing, grant a permit for the moving of overweight
vehicles, loads, objects or structures in excess of the dimensional limits as set out in
Section 109 or the weight limits set out in Part VIII (being Sections 114 to 127) of the
Highway Traffic Act pursuant to the provisions of Section 110 of the Highway Traffic Act,
R.S.O., 1990, Chapter H.8, as amended.

AND WHEREAS the Council of The Corporation of the City of Belleville reserves the
right to suspend or revoke a permit and to establish an appeal procedure pursuant to
the provisions of the Statutory Powers Procedure Act, R.S.O., 1990, Chapter S.22, as
amended.

AND WHEREAS the Council of The Corporation of the City of Belleville deems it
desirable to grant such permits.

NOW THEREFORE the Council of The Corporation of the City of Belleville enacts as
follows:
1. DEFINITIONS

In this by-law:

1.1. "Applicant" means the person making an application for a permit under
this by-law.

1.2 "Corporation" means The Corporation of the City of Belleville.

1.3. "Council” means the Mayor and Members of City Council of the City of
Belleville.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 2

1.4

1.5

1.6

1.7

1.8

1.9

"Director of Engineering and Public Works" means the person appointed
to administer and manage the provisions of this by-law for The
Corporation of the City of Belleville and includes his authorized
subordinates and assistants.

“Equipped Vehicle’ means a self propelled vehicle manufactured,
designed, redesigned, converted or reconstructed either temporarily or
permanently for snow clearing, snow hauling or for any other snow moving
purposes.

"Highway" includes a common and public highway, street, avenue,
parkway, driveway, square, place, bridge, viaduct or trestle, any part of
which is intended for or used by the general public for the passage of
vehicles and pedestrians and includes the area between the lateral
property lines thereof.

"Motor Vehicle" includes an automobile, motorcycle, motor assisted
bicycle unless otherwise indicated, and any other vehicle propelled or
driven otherwise than by muscular power, but does not include a street
car, or other motor vehicles running only upon rails, or a motorized snow
vehicle, traction engine, farm tractor, self-propelled implement of
husbandry or road building machine.

"Municipal By-Law Enforcement Officer" means the officer appointed to
enforce the provisions of this by-law or any other by-law and includes his
authorized subordinates or assistants, and by virtue of Section 15 of the
Police Services Act, R.S.O. 1990, Chapter P.15 as amended, such Officer
is a "Peace Officer".

"Officer" includes a municipal by-law enforcement officer, a police officer,
a special constable or a peace officer.

"Operator" means the driver of any vehicle for which a permit has been
issued and includes any person employed, engaged or contracted by the
"Owner".

"Owner" means the owner of an overweight and oversized vehicle, load,
object or structure for which a permit is sought or has been issued.

"Peace Officer" includes a police officer, a constable, a conservation
officer or other person employed for the preservation and maintenance of
the public peace and by virtue of Section 15 of the Police Services Act,
R.S.O., 1990, Chapter P.15, as amended, includes a municipal by-law
enforcement officer.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 3

1.13 "Permit" means a permit issued under this by-law that grants a privilege to
the holder thereof.

1.14 "Permit Holder" means the person to whom a permit is issued and
includes an authorized owner or operator.

1.15 "Person" includes an individual, but also a partnership and body corporate
and any association and the heirs, executors, administrators, successors
and assigns or other legal representatives thereof to whom the context
may apply.

1.16 "Trailer" means a vehicle that is at any time drawn upon a highway by a
motor vehicle, except an implement of husbandry, a mobile home, another
motor vehicle or any device or apparatus not designed to transport
persons or property, temporarily drawn, propelled or moved upon such
highway, and except a side car attached to a motorcycle, and shall be
considered a separate vehicle and not part of the motor vehicle by which it
is drawn.

1.17 1.17.1 ‘Vehicle" includes a motor vehicle, trailer, traction engine, farm
tractor, road building machine and any vehicle drawn, propelled
or driven by any kind of power, including muscular power, but
does not include a motorized snow vehicle or a street car;

1.17.2 “Emergency Vehicle" means a vehicle or combination of
vehicles which provide any emergency service and includes an
ambulance, a fire truck, a police vehicle, or a cardiac arrest
emergency vehicle;

1.17.3. "Municipal Service Vehicle" means any vehicle owned by the
Corporation or operated by employees of the Corporation and
shall include any vehicle contracted by the Corporation for the
purposes of providing municipal services.

2. EXEMPTION

2.1 The provisions of this by-law shall not apply to the following categories of
vehicles:

2.1.1 emergency vehicles; and,

2.1.2 Municipal Service Vehicles.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 4

3. ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT

3.1

3.2

3.3

3.4

The Council of the Corporation hereby appoints and authorizes the
Director of Engineering and Public Works to:

3.1.1 administer the provisions of this by-law;

3.1.2 issue permits on behalf of the Corporation;

3.1.3 sign all permits on behalf of the Corporation;

3.1.4 sign the Schedule “C” agreement on behalf of the Corporation;
3.1.5 limit the time for which a permit is issued;

3.1.6 designate particular highways or parts thereof which may be

used by a permit holder;

3.1.7 impose such other conditions on the permit holder that, in the
discretion of the Director of Engineering and Public Works, are
deemed necessary for the protection of persons and property
from injury or damage;

3.1.8 undertake any technical investigation or inspection for the
purposes of administering this by-law;

The permits referred to in this section are to grant to an applicant who has
filed a written application for the privilege of moving vehicles, loads,
objects or structures in excess of weight and size limits as set out in the
appropriate sections in Part VIII of the Highway Traffic Act, R.S.O., 1990,
Chapter H.8, as amended.

The Director of Engineering and Public Works is authorized to evaluate an
application and may require that the applicant provide a bond or other
security sufficient to cover the cost of repairing any possible damage to a
highway.

The Director of Engineering and Public Works is authorized to demand
identification or any documentary proof from any person making an
application for a permit under this by-law.

3.4.1 For the purposes of this by-law, any person refusing to provide
the Director of Engineering and Public Works with identification
or documentary proof at the time of the application shall be
deemed to have refused to provide such information.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 5

3.5

3.6

3.7

The Director of Engineering and Public Works may report to Council any
breach of the by-law by any permit holder.

The Council of the Corporation hereby appoints the Officer to enforce the
provisions of this by-law including the provisions of Sections 122 and 124
of the Highway Traffic Act, R.S.O., 1990, Chapter H.8, as amended.

The Director of Engineering and Public Works and the Officer are
authorized to:

3.7.1 demand the permit, identification, vehicle registration or other
document from any owner, permit holder or operator to whom
the by-law may apply; and,

3.7.2 inspect any vehicle, load, object or structure and any ledger,
weight bill or document for which a permit was issued in order to
verify or confirm the dimensions, weight, destination and type of
materials as provided in the application.

4. OBSTRUCTION

4.1

4.2

No person shall obstruct, hinder or interfere with the Director of
Engineering and Public Works or the officer in the lawful performance of
his duties.

No person shall cause the obstruction, hindrance or interference of the
Director of Engineering and Public Works or the officer in the performance
of his duties.

5. PERMIT REQUIRED

5.1

5.2

A permit shall be obtained by every:
5.1.1 owner, or

5.1.2 operator of any vehicles, loads, objects or structures for the
purpose prescribed in Section 3.2 of this by-law.

A separate permit shall be obtained by every owner or operator in respect
of each vehicle, load, object or structure as prescribed in Subsection 3.2
of this by-law.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 6

5.3

5.4

5.5

6.1

6.2

6.3

6.4

6.5

No person shall operate or cause to be moved an overweight and
oversized vehicle, load, object or structure upon any highway or part
thereof within the City of Belleville until a permit has been procured by the
owner or operator to do so.

No person shall be deemed to have been issued a permit until the Director
of Engineering and Public Works has issued the permit. An application for
a permit does not constitute a permit.

No owner, operator or any person shall operate a vehicle or combination
of vehicles contrary to any conditions of a permit.

APPLICATIONS

On the application for a permit, the applicant shall complete the prescribed
form and shall furnish the Corporation such information, documents and
other means of identification as the Corporation may direct to be
furnished. Such application shall be submitted to the Director of
Engineering and Public Works.

No permit shall be issued by the Director of Engineering and Public Works
unless and until he is in receipt of a non-refundable certified cheque
payable to the Corporation in the amount of:

6.2.1 the permit fee as set out in Schedule “B’, the “Guidelines for
Completing the City of Belleville Oversize/Overweight Permit
Application,” attached hereto and forming part of this by-law;
and,

6.2.2 when applicable, the bond or the security as prescribed in this
by-law.

The applicant shall file with the Corporation the duration and routes of the
equipment and vehicles requiring a permit in order that unnecessary traffic
hazards or delays are avoided.

A duly executed copy of an agreement as set forth in Schedule ‘C’ of this
by-law shall accompany each application for a permit.

Each permit shall indicate the date on which it expires.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 7

6.6

6.7

6.8

6.9

6.10

6.11

Any permit issued under this by-law shall remain the property of the
Corporation and such permit is not transferable to any other person except
between an owner of a vehicle and the operator, and is not transferable to
any other vehicle, load, object or structure.

No person shall give false or incorrect information for the purposes of
obtaining a permit. Any omission or misrepresentation by inadvertence or
otherwise that is material to the application, shall render a permit null and
void.

No person shall refuse to provide information for the purposes of obtaining
a permit.

The onus of procuring a permit shall be that of the person requiring a
permit.

Each application for a permit shall be on the prescribed form as set out in
Schedule ‘A’ to this by-law.

The applicant shall obtain the written consent of the following persons and
agencies (as required):

6.11.1 Fire and Emergency Services Department

6.11.2 Belleville Police Service

6.11.3. Veridian Connections

6.11.4 | Hydro One

6.11.5 Bell Canada

6.11.6 | Cogeco Cable

6.11.7 | Canadian Pacific Railway

6.11.8 | Canadian National Railway

6.11.9 — Traffic Technician, Engineering and Public Works Department
6.11.10 Director of Engineering and Public Works Department

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 8

7. CONDITIONS FOR ISSUANCE OF A PERMIT

7.1

7.2.

No permit may be issued by the Director of Engineering and Public Works

unless:

7.1.1

all the appropriate information pertaining to the vehicles, loads,
objects or structure has been provided in writing on the
application;

such further personal history and related information as required
has been provided;

the applicant has supplied proof of property damage and public
liability insurance for the minimum amount of five million
($5,000,000) dollars for the term of the permit as well as proof of
insurance covering any vehicle requiring such permit;

the applicant has paid all outstanding fines in respect to this by-
law ordered by a court of competent jurisdiction at any time and
in any year prior to making the application;

the owner, operator or permit holder of any such vehicle or
equipment, who has obtained a permit, is responsible for all
damages of whatsoever nature that may be caused by reason
of the driving, operating or moving of any such vehicle and/or
equipment;

the owner, operator or permit holder of any such vehicle, is
responsible for all damages whatsoever that may be caused to
the highway by reason of the driving, operating or moving of
such vehicles and/or equipment; and,

the permit may contain any special conditions or provisions that
in the opinion of the Director of Engineering and Public Works
may be deemed necessary for the protection of the public
and/or the highway.

Failure to comply with the requirements of Subsection 7.1.3 of this by-law
shall immediately render the permit null and void.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 9

8. PERMIT HOLDER'S DUTY

8.1. Every permit holder shall ensure that:

8.1.1

9. OFFENCES

the original permit is supplied to the operator in order that it may
be produced upon demand by the officer;

the operator of the vehicle used to transport the item for which a
permit was issued, travels upon the authorized highways only;

the permit is used for only the item for which it was issued;

the operator stops when directed to do so by the officer; and,
they have read, understood and complied with all the ‘Oversize/
Overweight Permit Provisions and Conditions’ which form part

of any permit issued and as included as Schedule ‘D’ in this by-
law.

9.1. No permit holder shall:

9.1.1

fail or refuse to produce the permit upon demand;
use any unauthorized highway or part thereof;

use the permit to move any thing other than the item for which
the permit was issued;

fail or refuse to stop when directed to do so by an officer;
fail or refuse to identify himself to the officer;

fail or refuse to produce the motor vehicle registration to the
officer; and,

when applicable, fail to produce the weigh bill for the current
load to the officer,

fail to abide by the conditions in the permit.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 10

10.

11.

12.

PERMIT HOLDER

10.1

An owner or operator who operates a vehicle for which a permit is issued
shall be deemed to be the permit holder.

SUSPENSION / REVOCATION

11.1

The Director of Engineering and Public Works may revoke any or each of
the permits issued for cause and without limiting the generality of the
foregoing for:

11.1.1 a breach of the law,

11.1.2. any violation of the provisions of this by-law,

The Director of Engineering and Public Works shall revoke any or each
permit issued for failure to maintain sufficient liability insurance policies.

The Director of Engineering and Public Works may suspend a permit for
cause, during any period that is less than the unexpired portion of the
permit period in lieu of revocation as provided herein.

The Director of Engineering and Public Works may suspend for cause any
permit for a period of four (4) weeks or until the next available meeting of
Council, whichever occurs first, and shall notify the Mayor and Members of
Council of such suspension.

The provisions of this section may be exercised in addition to any
prosecution or other legal action.

No person shall be deemed to acquire a permit if his permit has been
revoked in the past.

NOTICE OF SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION

12.1

12.2

When a permit has been suspended or revoked, the Director of
Engineering and Public Works shall send a notice of suspension or
revocation by registered mail or personal service to the permit holder at
his last known address.

Service by registered mail shall be deemed to have been made on the fifth
(5th) day after the notice was mailed.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 11

13.

14.

15.

12.3

12.4

The notice shall contain details of the reason(s) for the suspension or
revocation and shall also contain a paragraph to advise the person that he
may appeal the decision by filing an appeal according to the provisions of
Section 13 of this by-law.

Any person contravening any of the provisions of this by-law while under
suspension shall be regarded as though no permit had been issued.

APPEAL OF SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION

13.1

13.2

Any person whose permit has been suspended or revoked may appeal to
City Council within fifteen (15) days immediately following the service of
the notice referred to in Section 12 hereof;

City Council shall, within a reasonable time after receiving an appeal
notice, hold a hearing at a place and time convenient to both parties in
order to afford the person an opportunity to make representation.

SEVERABILITY

14.1

If a court of competent jurisdiction should declare any section or part of a
section of this by-law to be invalid, such section or part thereof shall not be
construed as having persuaded or influenced Council to pass the
remainder of this by-law and it is hereby declared that the remainder of
this by-law shall be valid and shall remain in force.

PENALTIES

15.1

15.2

15.3

Any person who contravenes any provision of this by-law or who operates
a vehicle or combination of vehicles contrary to any conditions of a permit
is guilty of an offence and upon conviction, is liable to a fine of not less
than two hundred ($200) dollars and not more than twenty thousand,
($20,000) dollars exclusive of costs.

Any person who contravenes any provision of this by-law, for which a
penalty is provided in this by-law, is guilty of an offence and upon
conviction, is subject to the penalties provided therefore in this by-law and
pursuant to the provisions of the Highway Traffic Act.

In addition to imposing a fine, a Court of competent jurisdiction may, upon
conviction of an offence under this by-law, issue an order prohibiting the
continuation or repetition of the violation by the person convicted.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 12

15.4

Every person who operates or permits the operation of a vehicle or
combination of vehicles where the gross vehicle weight exceeds the gross
vehicle weight allowed under the permit is guilty of an offence and on
conviction, a fine shall be imposed as if the person had not been issued
the permit under this by-law and had been convicted of an offence under
Section 116, 117 or 118 of the Highway Traffic Act in respect of any gross
vehicle weight, axle unit weight or axle group weight in excess of the
maximum allowable weights under the Highway Traffic Act or the
regulations.

16. ADMINISTRATION

16.1

THAT By-Law Number 2004-11 is hereby rescinded and all by-laws or
parts of by-laws inconsistent with the provisions of this By-Law are hereby
rescinded.

THIS BY-LAW SHALL COME INTO FORCE AND TAKE EFFECT IMMEDIATELY ON
AND AFTER THE PASSING THEREOF.

Read a second time this 14" day of November, 2005.

GUIDELINES FOR COMPLETING THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE
OVERSIZE/OVERWEIGHT PERMIT APPLICATION

An oversize/overweight permit allows the movement of oversize/overweight vehicles,
indivisible loads, objects or structures on City of Belleville roadways which exceed the
limits set out in the Highway Traffic Act.
MAXIMUM WIDTH:
e Vehicle including load — 2.6 metres
MAXIMUM LENGTH:
e Single vehicle including load — 12.5 metres
e Semi-trailer including load — 14.65 metres
(Semi-trailer — a vehicle that is towed by another vehicle)
MAXIMUM LENGTH (COMBINATION):
e Combination of vehicles and load — 23 metres
MAXIMUM HEIGHT:
e Vehicle and load — 4.15 metres
MAXIMUM WEIGHT:
e Maximum weight allowances are determined by the axle configurations and
spacings and gross weights set out in the Highway Traffic Act.
PERMIT APPLICATION PROCESS:
Application forms must be completed in full and may be submitted by fax, e-mail, mail,

or in person at Belleville City Hall, 2"? Floor, Engineering and Public Works Department,
169 Front Street, Belleville, Ontario.

Incomplete applications will be returned.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 14

If travel is also required on Provincial Highways, please contact the Ontario Ministry of
Transportation (MTO) to receive the necessary permit.

CONSIDERATION OF PERMIT ISSUER:
In reviewing applications consideration is given to a number of factors, including:

Complete application.

Effect of proposed move on the safety and convenience of other road users.
Effect on existing public infrastructure.

Known physical characteristics of proposed route.

Does the application involve the relocation or movement of a building?
Likely traffic conditions at the time of move.

Any special events during the proposed time of move.

Distance and length of time of move.

Can loads be reduced in size and/or weight (alternate configurations)?

Is a Traffic Management Plan required for exceptional moves?

TYPES OF PERMITS:

The City of Belleville issues three (3) types of permits: Annual, Seasonal, and Single
trip.

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 16

Annual Permits -
Annual permits are valid for a period of twelve (12) months from the date of issuance.

Annual permits can be considered for vehicles with the following maximum dimensions:

Length: 12.5 metres
Width: 3.7 metres
Height: 4.26 metres

4
Seasonal Permits -

Seasonal permits are issued to allow operators to move similar loads,
vehicles, over the same route for a period of up to and including six (6)
months.

Single Trip Permits -

A single trip permit is issued to facilitate an oversize/overweight move for
a one (1) way trip along a specified route for a limited time period:

Length: - Combination vehicles from 23m to 45.75 metres
- Single vehicle 12.5 metres
Width: From 2.61m to 4 metres
Height: 4.16 metres or greater
Weight: If Highway Traffic Act limits are exceeded, may

require additional conditions at Director of
Engineering and Public Works discretion.

Permit Fees -
Annual Permit: $200.00
Seasonal Permit: $150.00
Single Trip Permit: $ 75.00
Permit Replacement: $ 15.00
NIGHT MOVES:

Night moves are generally not permitted within the City of Belleville. In addition, no
travel is allowed when road conditions, weather conditions, or visibility make traveling
hazardous to the operator or to the driving public. If inclement weather occurs while the
move is under way, operators shall at the first opportunity park in a safe place (clear of
the traveled portion of the roadway) until the weather and road conditions clear.

FLAGS, SIGNS, AND MARKINGS:

By-Law Number 2005-200 Page 17

Vehicles and/or loads in excess of the Highway Traffic Act legal dimensions require
special flags, signs, and markings. Any vehicle/load receiving an oversize/overweight
permit from the City of Belleville must conform to the requirements for vehicle and/or
load marking provisions contained with the Highway Traffic Act.

ESCORT REQUIREMENTS:

A permit may be issued on the condition that the permit holder provides an escort
vehicle(s).

Height: 4.15 metres and greater Escort required

Width: 2.61m to 3.99m No escort required
4.00m to 4.99m Private escort required
5.00m and greater Police escort required

Length: 23.01m to 36.75m No escort required
36.76m to 45.74m Private escort required
45.75m and greater Police escort required

Weight: All loads/vehicles must conform to the legal restrictions of the

Highway Traffic Act.

There may be other occasions where private and/or police escort is warranted,
particularly where major intersections will be disrupted for a lengthy period.

THIS AGREEMENT made on this day of , 2005

BETWEEN:

(Hereinafter called the “Applicant”)

THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE

(Hereinafter called the City)

WHEREAS the Applicant has applied to the City to drive

over the highways in the City of Belleville

NOW THEREFORE in consideration of the City issuing a permit to the Applicant for the
use of a highway or part thereof by a vehicle in excess of the dimensional limits as set
out in the Highway Traffic Act, or the weight limits prescribed by said Act, the Applicant
agrees as follows:

1.

The Applicant and/or any employees of the Applicant undertake to the City to use

TO BY-LAW NUMBER 2005-200

OVERSIZE/OVERWEIGHT PERMIT
PROVISIONS AND CONDITIONS

. Notwithstanding any of the provisions of this permit, the Belleville Police Services or the
City of Belleville may change or cancel this permit and may cause the vehicle(s) and load
to be removed from the roadway due to congestion or hazardous conditions being
encountered as a result of the unit being on the road, and may require the operator to wait
for an escort to continue the move.

. The applicant will satisfy themselves as to the suitability of the approved route for the
proposed movement. No representations are made by municipal authorities as to the
clearances and capacities involved therein. The applicant shall verify for themselves all
structure clearance heights and widths, on site, forty-eight (48) hours prior to move.

. In consideration of the issuance of this permit and other good and valuable consideration,
the applicant, their heirs, executors, administrators, or assigns, hereby agree to indemnify
and save harmless, the City of Belleville from any action, claim, damages, costs (including
legal costs) or loss whatsoever, arising from operations carried out under this permit.

. The applicant shall show proof of having obtained a building permit where applicable for the
movement of buildings. Buildings moved from within the City of Belleville must have sewers
capped and be inspected by the City’s Building/Plumbing Inspector. Applicant must give a
minimum of twenty-four (24) hours written notice to the City’s Development Services
Department prior to commencing the move.

. The applicant may be required to file a bond and/or certified cheque with this application in
such an amount as at the discretion of the City of Belleville, utility, or railroad, as deemed
necessary to cover the cost of facilitating the move and of repairing any damages resulting
therefrom.

. All authorized signatures of the City of Belleville and the agencies indicated as required on
this permit shall be obtained before this permit is considered to be valid.

. Any violations of this permit, or the provisions and conditions therein, may result in the
permit being cancelled.

This permit shall accompany the vehicle for which it is issued. In the case of
multi-vehicle permits, a copy of the permit and supplemental list of vehicles shall
accompany each vehicle. The permit and all attachments shall be produced upon
request of the officer.

This permit is not valid at any time from one-half hour after sunset, to one-half
hour before sunrise, or at any other time when, due to insufficient light, or
unfavourable atmosphere conditions, persons and vehicles on the highway are
not clearly discernable at a distance of 150 metres or less, or from Monday to
Friday inclusive during the hours of 6:30 a.m. - 9:00 a.m., and 4:00 p.m. — 6:00
p.m.

Any vehicles and/or loads exceeding the legal width, length or weight limits
identified in the Highway Traffic Act must be flagged, signed and/or marked as
per the requirements of the Highway Traffic Act.

This permit is issued on condition the permit holder accepts responsibility for any
and all damage(s) that may be caused to overhead wires, fibre optic cables,
structures, roads, encroachments, railways or any other public or private property
as a result of the move.

The permit holder must comply with all other requirements of the Highway Traffic
Act.

This permit is valid only on roadways under the jurisdiction of the City of
Belleville.

zones where clearances may be reduced. The permit holder is responsible for
obtaining any route amendment that may be necessary due to construction
